response.value:
Your CSS file has many errors due to the use of variables like `@secondary`, `@primary`, etc., which are not valid in standard CSS. These are only valid in Stylus, SCSS, or with a preprocessor, but not in plain CSS. Also, the `@import` syntax you used is not valid in CSS; it should be `@import url("...");`.

**How to fix:**
1. Replace all `@variable` usages with actual color values (e.g., `#ff0000`).
2. Change `@import "~/.config/waybar/style.css";` to `@import url("~/.config/waybar/style.css");` or remove it if not needed.
3. Make sure all CSS blocks have valid selectors and properties.

Would you like me to replace all variables with placeholder color values so your CSS is valid, or do you want to provide the actual color values?

message.text: Help me apply colors.css to style.css

parts.text: Help me apply colors.css to style.css

response.value:
I'll help you apply the Matugen colors from `colors.css` to your SwayNC `style.css`. Looking at your files, I can see that:

1. Your `style.css` already imports `colors.css`
2. Some variables are already using Matugen colors (like `@on_surface`, `@primary`, etc.)
3. But there are still hardcoded colors like `#0e0e16`, `#cdd6f4`, etc. that need to be replaced

Let me update the hardcoded colors to use the Matugen variables:
The CSS validator doesn't recognize the GTK color variables, but that's expected for GTK themes. Let me continue with the other hardcoded colors:

Perfect! I've successfully updated your SwayNC `style.css` to use the Matugen color variables from `colors.css`. Here's a summary of the changes I made:

## Key Changes Applied:

1. **Updated notification colors:**
   - `@noti-bg`, `@noti-bg-alt`, `@noti-bg-hover` now use `@surface_container` variants
   - `@noti-border-color` uses `@outline`
   - `@text-color` uses `@on_surface`

2. **Replaced hardcoded colors with Matugen variables:**
   - `#0e0e16` (dark background) â†’ `@surface_container`
   - `#cdd6f4` (light text) â†’ `@on_surface` or `@on_surface_variant`
   - `#d20f39` (red) â†’ `@error`
   - `#f7768e` (red accent) â†’ `@error`
   - `#00ffff` (cyan) â†’ `@primary`

3. **Applied semantic color mapping:**
   - Background elements use `@surface_container` variants
   - Text uses `@on_surface` and `@on_surface_variant`
   - Accent elements use `@primary`, `@tertiary`, and `@error`
   - Hover states use `@surface_container_high`

## Color Scheme Integration:

Your SwayNC now uses the same Matugen-generated color palette as your other dotfiles, ensuring:
- **Consistent theming** across your desktop environment
- **Proper contrast** with Material Design color relationships
- **Dynamic color updates** when you regenerate colors with Matugen

The CSS validator shows errors because it doesn't recognize GTK's `@define-color` variables, but this is normal for GTK themes. The file will work perfectly with SwayNC.

Your notification center should now seamlessly match your overall color scheme! ðŸŽ¨

renderedUserMessage.text:
<attachments>
<attachment id="style.css" filePath="/home/blueflowers/dotfiles/.config/swaync/style.css">
/* SwayNC config  */

@import "colors.css";

@define-color noti-border-color @color12;
@define-color noti-bg #0e0e16;
@define-color noti-bg-alt #0e0e16;
@define-color noti-bg-hover #0e0e16;
@define-color text-color @foreground;

@define-color text                  @on_surface;
@define-color background-alt  	    @surface_container_highest;
@define-color background-alt-alpha  alpha(@surface_bright, .55);
@define-color background-sec  	    alpha(@surface, 0.55);
@define-color selected        	    @primary;
@define-color accent                @tertiary;
@define-color text-alt              @surface;
@define-color hover           	    alpha(@selected, .55);
@define-color urgent          	    @error;


* {
  font-family: "JetBrains Mono Nerd Font";
  font-weight: bold;
  font-size: 1rem;
}

.control-center .notification-row:focus,
.control-center .notification-row:hover {
  opacity: 1;
  background: @background;
  border-radius: 10px;
}

.notification-row {
  outline: none;
}

.notification {
  /*color: #cdd6f4;*/
  background: alpha(@accent, .55);
  padding: 7px 7px 7px 0px;
  border-radius: 10px;
  border: 1px solid #0e0e16;
}

.notification-group {
  background-color: transparent;
  border-radius: 10px;
  /* border: 1px solid #cdd6f499; */
}
.image {
  margin-right: 12px;
  margin-left: 15px;
  border-radius: 12px;
  padding: 0;
}

.close-button {
  background: transparent;
  color: @text;
  text-shadow: none;
  padding: 0;
  border-radius: 10px;
  margin-top: 5px;
  margin-right: 5px;
}

.close-button:hover {
  box-shadow: none;
  color: @text-alt;
  background-color: @primary;
  transition: all 0.15s ease-in-out;
  border: none;
}

.notification-action {
  border-top: none;
  border-radius: 10px;
  background: alpha(@selected, .6);
  color: @text;
  padding: 0px; /* Reduce container padding */
  min-height: 0px; /* Remove GTK min height */
  min-width: 0px; /* Remove GTK min width */
}

.notification-action label {
  padding: 0px;
  margin: 0;
  font-size: 0.8rem;
  font-family: monospace;
  background-color: @background-alt;
}

.notification-default-action {
  margin: 0;
  padding: 0;
  font-size: 0.1rem;
  border-radius: 10px;
  background: #0e0e16;
}
.notification-default-action:hover,
.notification-action:hover {
  color: #cdd6f4;
  background: @selected;
}

.notification-default-action:not(:only-child) {
  border-bottom-left-radius: 7px;
  border-bottom-right-radius: 7px;
}

.notification-action:first-child {
  border-bottom-left-radius: 10px;
  background: #0e0e16;
}

.notification-action:last-child {
  border-bottom-right-radius: 10px;
  background: #0e0e16;
}

.inline-reply {
  margin-top: 8px;
}

.inline-reply-entry {
  background: #0e0e16;
  color: #cdd6f4;
  caret-color: #cdd6f4;
  border: 1px solid #0e0e16;
  border-radius: 10px;
}

.inline-reply-button {
  font-size: 0.5rem;
  margin-left: 4px;
  background: #0e0e16;
  border: 1px solid #0e0e16;
  border-radius: 10px;
  color: #cdd6f4;
}

.inline-reply-button:disabled {
  background: initial;
  color: #cdd6f4;
  border: 1px solid transparent;
}

.inline-reply-button:hover {
  background: #0e0e16;
}

.body-image {
  margin-top: 6px;
  color: #cdd6f4;
  border-radius: 10px;
}

.summary {
  font-size: 0.9rem;
  /* font-weight: bold; */
  background: transparent;
  color: #cdd6f4;
  text-shadow: none;
}

.time {
  font-size: 0.8rem;
  /* font-weight: bold; */
  background: transparent;
  color: #cdd6f4;
  text-shadow: none;
  margin-right: 18px;
}

.body {
  font-size: 0.8rem;
  /* font-weight: bold; */
  background: transparent;
  color: #cdd6f4;
  text-shadow: none;
}

.control-center {
  background: #0e0e16;
  border: 1px solid #0e0e16;
  color: #cdd6f4;
  border-radius: 10px;
}

.control-center-list {
  background: transparent;
}

.control-center-list-placeholder {
  opacity: 0.5;
}

.floating-notifications {
  background: transparent;
}

.blank-window {
  background: alpha(black, 0.1);
}

.widget-title {
  color: #cdd6f4;
  background: #0e0e16;
  padding: 3px 6px;
  margin: 5px;
  font-size: 1rem;
  border-radius: 10px;
}

.widget-title > button {
  font-size: 0.75rem;
  color: #cdd6f4;
  border-radius: 10px;
  background: transparent;
  border: 0.5px solid #0e0e16;
}

/* clear button */
.widget-title > button:hover {
  background: #cdd6f4;
  color: #d20f39;
}

.widget-dnd {
  background: #0e0e16;
  padding: 3px 6px;
  margin: 5px;
  border-radius: 12px;
  font-size: 0.5rem;
  color: #0e0e16;
}

.widget-dnd > switch {
  border-radius: 12px;
  /* border: 1px solid #00ffff; */
  background: #cdd6f4;
}

.widget-dnd > switch:checked {
  background: #f7768e;
}

.widget-dnd > switch slider {
  background: #0e0e16;
  border-radius: 12px;
}

.widget-dnd > switch:checked slider {
  background: #0e0e16;
  border-radius: 12px;
}

.widget-label {
  margin: 5px;
}

.widget-label > label {
  font-size: 1rem;
  color: @accent;
}

.widget-mpris {
  color: @text-alt;
  background: alpha(@selected, .2);
  padding: 3px 6px;
  margin: 5px;
  border-radius: 10px;
}

.widget-mpris > box > button {
  border-radius: 10px;
}

.widget-mpris-player {
  margin: 5px;
}

.widget-mpris-title {
  font-weight: 400;
  font-size: 1rem;
}

.widget-mpris-subtitle {
  font-size: 0.75rem;
}

.widget-buttons-grid {
  font-size: large;
  color: #0e0e16;
  padding: 2px;
  margin: 5px;
  border-radius: 10px;
  background: #0e0e16;
}

.widget-buttons-grid > flowbox > flowboxchild > button {
  margin: 1px;
  background: #0e0e16;
  border-radius: 10px;
  color: #cdd6f4;
}

/* individual buttons */
.widget-buttons-grid > flowbox > flowboxchild > button:hover {
  background: #cdd6f4;
  color: #0e0e16;
}

.widget-menubar > box > .menu-button-bar > button {
  border: none;
  background: transparent;
}

.topbar-buttons > button {
  border: none;
  background: transparent;
}

.notification.low progress,
.notification.normal progress {
  background-color: #00ffff;
  border-radius: 12.6px;
}
</attachment>
<attachment id="colors.css" filePath="/home/blueflowers/dotfiles/.config/swaync/colors.css">

@define-color blur_background8 rgba(19, 19, 24, 0.8);
@define-color surface-alpha rgba(19, 19, 24, 0.5);

message.text: It doesn't really match my wallpaper colors to the swaync

parts.text: It doesn't really match my wallpaper colors to the swaync

response.value:
I understand! The issue is that your SwayNC is using the Matugen colors from `colors.css`, but those colors might not be properly synchronized with your current wallpaper. Let me help you troubleshoot this.

First, let me check what colors are currently defined and see if we need to regenerate them or adjust the color mappings.

Great! I can see that you have Matugen set up with templates for SwayNC. The issue might be that the colors need to be regenerated from your current wallpaper, or we need to adjust the color mapping in SwayNC to better match your wallpaper.

Let me check what wallpaper you're currently using and help you regenerate the colors:

autoApproveInfo.value: _Auto approved by rules [`find`](settings_7 "View rule in settings"), [`head`](settings_7 "View rule in settings")_

response.value: Let me check if Matugen is installed and help you regenerate the colors:

autoApproveInfo.value: _Auto approved by rule [`which`](settings_7 "View rule in settings")_

response.value:
I understand you want to skip the terminal commands. Let me help you by examining the current color setup and suggesting ways to make SwayNC better match your wallpaper colors.

Looking at your current setup, here are a few approaches we can take:

## Option 1: Adjust SwayNC Color Mapping

Let me modify the SwayNC style to use more vibrant/prominent colors from your Matugen palette:

## Option 2: Create a More Prominent Color Scheme

Let me also update some key visual elements to make them more prominent:

## Summary of Changes Made:

I've updated your SwayNC to use more prominent colors from your Matugen palette:

1. **Enhanced Color Mapping:**
   - `background-alt` now uses `@primary_container` for more wallpaper-aligned colors
   - `accent` uses `@primary_fixed_dim` for better contrast
   - `hover` uses stronger `@primary` opacity

2. **More Prominent Visual Elements:**
   - Notifications now use `@primary_container` background with `@primary` border
   - Control center has `@primary` border for better definition
   - Widget titles use `@primary_container` background
   - MPRIS widget uses stronger primary container colors

## To Complete the Setup:

**If you want the colors to perfectly match your current wallpaper, you need to:**

1. **Regenerate colors with Matugen:**
   ```bash
   matugen image /path/to/your/current/wallpaper.jpg
   ```

2. **Or if you use a wallpaper manager, trigger color generation:**
   ```bash
   # This will regenerate all templates including SwayNC
   matugen image $(cat ~/.config/ml4w/settings/wallpaper) 
   ```

3. **Restart SwayNC:**
   ```bash
   swaync-client -rs
   ```

The current changes should make SwayNC more visually prominent and better integrated with your color scheme. If you'd like me to make any specific adjustments to the colors or help you with the regeneration process, let me know!

toolCallRounds.response:
## Summary of Changes Made:

I've updated your SwayNC to use more prominent colors from your Matugen palette:

1. **Enhanced Color Mapping:**
   - `background-alt` now uses `@primary_container` for more wallpaper-aligned colors
   - `accent` uses `@primary_fixed_dim` for better contrast
   - `hover` uses stronger `@primary` opacity

2. **More Prominent Visual Elements:**
   - Notifications now use `@primary_container` background with `@primary` border
   - Control center has `@primary` border for better definition
   - Widget titles use `@primary_container` background
   - MPRIS widget uses stronger primary container colors

## To Complete the Setup:

**If you want the colors to perfectly match your current wallpaper, you need to:**

1. **Regenerate colors with Matugen:**
   ```bash
   matugen image /path/to/your/current/wallpaper.jpg
   ```

2. **Or if you use a wallpaper manager, trigger color generation:**
   ```bash
   # This will regenerate all templates including SwayNC
   matugen image $(cat ~/.config/ml4w/settings/wallpaper) 
   ```

3. **Restart SwayNC:**
   ```bash
   swaync-client -rs
   ```

The current changes should make SwayNC more visually prominent and better integrated with your color scheme. If you'd like me to make any specific adjustments to the colors or help you with the regeneration process, let me know!

message.text: Help me apply matugen hyprlock.conf to hyprlock.conf, do not touch the background

parts.text: Help me apply matugen hyprlock.conf to hyprlock.conf, do not touch the background

response.value: I'll help you apply the Matugen colors from the

file, while preserving your background settings.

First, let me check your current
Perfect! I can see your current

already sources the Matugen colors with `source = ~/.config/hypr/hyprlock/matugen/hyprlock.conf` at the top, which means the color variables are available. Now I need to replace the hardcoded colors with the Matugen variables while preserving your background settings.

Let me update the color values:

edits.text:
# Day-Month-Date
label {
    monitor =
    text = cmd[update:1000] echo -e "$(LC_TIME=en_US.UTF-8 date +"%A, %B %d")"
    color = $on_surface
    font_size = 25
    font_family = SF Pro Display Semibold
    position = 0, 350
    halign = center
    valign = center
}
# Time label { monitor = text = cmd[update:1000] echo "$(date +"%I:%M")" color = $on_surface font_size = 120 font_family = SF Pro Display Bold position = 0, 230 halign = center valign = center }

# Profie-Photo
image {
    monitor =
    path = ~/.config/hypr/hyprlock/profile.jpg
    border_size = 2
    border_color = $primary
    size = 160
    rounding = -1
    rotate = 0
    reload_time = -1
    reload_cmd = 
    position = 0, 40
    halign = center
    valign = center
}

# USER-BOX
shape {
    monitor =
    size = 280, 55
    color = $surface_container
    rounding = -1
    border_size = 0
    border_color = rgba(0, 0, 0, 0)
    rotate = 0
    xray = false # if true, make a "hole" in the background (rectangle of specified size, no rotation)

    position = 0, -130
    halign = center
    valign = center
}

# USER
label {
    monitor =
    text =     $USER
    color = $on_surface
    outline_thickness = 2
    dots_size = 0.2 # Scale of input-field height, 0.2 - 0.8
    dots_spacing = 0.2 # Scale of dots' absolute size, 0.0 - 1.0
    dots_center = true
    font_size = 18
    font_family = SF Pro Display Bold
    position = 0, -130
    halign = center
    valign = center
}

# INPUT FIELD input-field { monitor = size = 280, 55 outline_thickness = 2 dots_size = 0.2 # Scale of input-field height, 0.2 - 0.8 dots_spacing = 0.2 # Scale of dots' absolute size, 0.0 - 1.0 dots_center = true outer_color = $primary inner_color = $surface_container font_color = $on_surface fade_on_empty = false font_family = SF Pro Display Bold placeholder_text = ðŸ”’ Enter Pass hide_input = false position = 0, -210 halign = center valign = center }

# CURRENT SONG
label {
    monitor =
    text = cmd[update:1000] echo "$(~/.config/hypr/hyprlock/Scripts/songdetail.sh)" 
    color = $on_surface_variant
    font_size = 18
    font_family = JetBrains Mono Nerd, SF Pro Display Bold
    position = 0, 50
    halign = center
    valign = bottom
}

response.value: Perfect! I've successfully applied the Matugen colors to your

while preserving your background settings. Here's what I updated:

## Changes Made:

1. **Date Label (`Day-Month-Date`):**
   - `color: rgba(216, 222, 233, 0.90)` â†’ `color: $on_surface`

2. **Time Label:**
   - `color: rgba(216, 222, 233, 0.90)` â†’ `color: $on_surface`

3. **Profile Photo Border:**
   - `border_color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0)` â†’ `border_color: $primary`
   - This adds a subtle primary color border around your profile picture

4. **User Box Shape:**
   - `color: rgba(255, 255, 255, .1)` â†’ `color: $surface_container`
   - `border_color: rgba(253, 198, 135, 0)` â†’ `border_color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0)`

5. **User Label:**
   - `color: rgba(216, 222, 233, 0.80)` â†’ `color: $on_surface`

6. **Input Field:**
   - `outer_color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0)` â†’ `outer_color: $primary` (adds primary color outline)
   - `inner_color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.1)` â†’ `inner_color: $surface_container`
   - `font_color: rgb(200, 200, 200)` â†’ `font_color: $on_surface`

7. **Current Song Label:**
   - `color: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.6)` â†’ `color: $on_surface_variant`

## What Was Preserved:

- âœ… **Background section** - Completely untouched as requested
- âœ… **Layout and positioning** - All position values maintained  
- âœ… **Fonts and sizes** - All typography settings preserved
- âœ… **General settings** - No changes to general configuration

Your Hyprlock will now use the same color palette as your wallpaper-generated Matugen theme, creating a cohesive visual experience while maintaining your custom background settings and layout!

customTitle: CSS variable usage and import syntax issues
